repnme.cdata!:
Benin and Senegal - West and Central Africa
            Air Transport Safety and Security Program Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the West and Central Africa
            Air Transport Safety and Security Program Project for Benin
            and Senegal were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome was substantial;
            Bank performance was moderately satisfactory; and borrower
            performance was moderately unsatisfactory. Some lessons
            learned includes: the justification of the overall outcome
            rating for the project put more weight to International
            Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) audits recommendations.
            The effectiveness of this project was delayed significantly
            for Senegal due to the multiplicity of effectiveness
            conditions. There should therefore be a consideration for
            the elimination of effectiveness conditions to avoid delays
            in effectiveness by making sure that all conditions are met
            prior to negotiations. The performance of one country during
            implementation had a great impact on the overall performance
            of the project. There was lack of a realistic assessment of
            the initial cost of various activities which resulted in
            overestimation of these activities. Similar future projects
            should avoid any complex and over design of activities.
            There is a need to engage and receive strong support from
            country management units to ensure stronger ownership by the
            countries involved and to resolve policy related an issue as
            this was found helpful in this project. Project design
            should include an agreed exit strategy with an action plan
            which defines clear responsibilities during all stages of
            implementation to ensure that each agency concerned has a
            good grasp of its role and is committed to its implementation.
